Special Breakfast: Kanchipuram IdlyÂ  Servings: 3 Duration: 15 mins One of the most famous recipe from Kanchipuram, south India ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³Â These idli's are so soft and infused with Pepper and Asafoetida flavours. All you need to do make Idly Batter ahead & handy ingredients at kitchen shelves.. This idly can serve with any kind of chutney's and Podi.. Today I prepared kanchipuram Idly and served with
  • Idly podi
  • Coconut ğŸŒ´ Chutney
Let's start with Ingredients and follows with Procedure Ingredients:
  • Idly BatterÂ - As required - I used 600 ml
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Chana Dal/ Bengal gram - 1/2 tb sp
  • Urad dal - 1/2 tb sp
  • Curry leaves - 12 - chopped
  • Green chillies - 1 - finely chopped
  • Cashew nuts - 14 pieces
  • Black pepper powder - coarse - 1/2 tsp
  • Hing/ Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp - any cooking oil
Procedure:
  • Heat tempering pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds. Let them splutter
  • Next add urad dal, Chana Dal, curry leaves, green chillies & cashew nuts, Saute
  • Add Pepper powder & hing when they're turning to golden brown
  • Saute & turn off heat
  • Transfer this mixture in Idly batter
  • Combine well and fill batter in Idly mold (as shown in picture)
  • Steam for 10 mins in Idly cooker
  • Turn off heat let it set 5 mins and open lid
  • Idli's cooked well, now it's time to serve
  • Enjoy kanchipuram Idly with your lovely combination ğŸ˜
